sentence: Unilever PLC ( UL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 03, 2016.
A cash dividend payment of $0.3296 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 09, 2016.
Shareholders who purchased UL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an -4.05% decrease from the prior quarter.
The previous trading day's last sale of UL was $44.42, representing a -3.83% decrease from the 52 week high of $46.19 and a 15.08% increase over the 52 week low of $38.60.
UL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
Zacks Investment Research reports UL's forecasted earnings growth in 2016 as 5.45%, compared to an industry average of 4.9%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the UL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
